content: The Act may be cited as the "National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2013". The Board of Directors of the Foundation is established. The National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act is amended to appoint 28 Directors knowledgeable in conservation of natural resources. The National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act is amended to appoint 28 Directors for 6-year terms. The Foundation shall have an Executive Director appointed by the Board as the chief executive. The National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act is amended to appoint 28 Directors for 6-year terms. The Foundation shall have an Executive Director appointed by the Board as the chief executive, knowledgeable and experienced in matters relating to fish and wildlife conservation. Additionally, a conforming amendment changes the title from "Secretary of the Board" to "Executive Director of the Board" in the North American Wetlands Conservation Act. SEC. 3. RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE FOUNDATION. Section 4 of the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act (16 U.S.C. 3703) is amended to redefine the powers of the Foundation, including the management of funds in financial institutions that are members of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation or the Securities Investment Protection Corporation. The National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act is amended to redefine the Foundation's powers, including managing funds in financial institutions that are members of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation or the Securities Investment Protection Corporation. Amendments include receiving and administering various payments and amounts from legal proceedings. The National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act is amended to redefine the Foundation's powers, including managing funds for conservation purposes and carrying out necessary acts. Real property interests are treated to include easements for preservation and enhancement of natural resources. The National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act is amended to redefine the Foundation's powers, including managing funds for conservation purposes and carrying out necessary acts. Gifts, devises, or bequests may be accepted even if encumbered, restricted, or subject to beneficial interests of private persons for the benefit of the Foundation. Acceptance and administration of amounts by the Foundation do not alter regulatory or statutory requirements. Subsections (f) and (g) are struck, and subsections (h) and (i) are redesignated as subsections (f) and (g), respectively. The National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act is amended to redefine the Foundation's powers, including managing funds for conservation purposes. Acceptance and administration of amounts by the Foundation do not alter regulatory or statutory requirements. Subsections (f) and (g) are struck, and subsections (h) and (i) are redesignated as subsections (f) and (g), respectively. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2014 through 2019 to the Secretaries of the Interior, Agriculture, and Commerce. Federal agencies may also provide additional funding. Federal departments, agencies, or instrumentalities may provide Federal funds to the Foundation for conservation purposes. Advances can be given in a lump sum, and the Foundation can collect management fees for the funds received. The Federal departments, agencies, or instrumentalities may provide Federal funds to the Foundation for conservation purposes. The funds can be used by State and local government agencies and other entities. In administering the funds, Federal entities have the discretion to waive competitive processes when entering into contracts or agreements. The Foundation may receive Federal funds for conservation purposes, with Federal entities having discretion to waive competitive processes for contracts or agreements in cases of environmental emergencies or to expedite conservation efforts. The Foundation must report on these waivers in its annual report. The Foundation may use gifts, devises, or bequests of money or property for conservation purposes, allowing Federal departments, agencies, or instrumentalities to accept and expend these funds without further appropriation, as long as they are used to further conservation efforts. The Foundation may use gifts, money, or property for conservation purposes to further the conservation and management of natural resources. SEC. 5. LIMITATION ON AUTHORITY. Amendment to the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act to include "exclusive" before "authority".
